question_sentence: Dolly Parton announced this week that she will be starring in a TikTok musical about:
Tom Brady will join which company as a broadcaster after he retires?
Andy Warhol's “Shot Sage Blue Marilyn” sold for how much this week?
What did President Biden call his “top domestic priority” this week?
Boxer Canelo Álvarez lost to Dmitry Bivol on Saturday, marking his first loss since:
US gas prices hit an all-time high Tuesday, with the average cost for regular gas being:
Which "Succession" actor glued themselves to a Starbucks counter to protest the coffee chain's extra charge for plant-based milk?
Tesla has recalled 129,960 cars because of issues that could cause:
choices: The vehicle's battery to drain instantly

question_sentence: Which NBA star was named the league MVP this week?
The Senate failed to pass a bill that would make abortion legal nationally. Which Democratic senator voted against the legislation?
How many times has the Queen now missed the State Opening of Parliament after Prince Charles stood in for her this week?
evidence: The Queen missed the opening due to ‘episodic mobility problems’. The previous two occasions were due to pregnancy

question_sentence: Which Conservative MP was criticised for telling parliament people who use food banks ‘cannot budget’ or ‘cook properly’?
evidence: Anderson claimed people could ‘cook meals from scratch’ for ‘30p a day’ instead of using food banks. ‘We have generation after generation who cannot cook properly,’ he added

question_sentence: Unlike dogs, which some studies suggest can benefit from a vegan diet, which domesticated animal should never be fed a plant-based diet?
evidence: Dogs are omnivores, and so can be put on a carefully thought-out vegan diet, but cats are ‘obligate carnivores’, meaning it is impossible to ensure they have a nutritional diet without meat

question_sentence: Which country announced its intention to join Nato in the wake of the Russian invasion of Ukraine?
evidence: President Sauli Niinistö is expected to announce his formal approval for Finland to join Nato on Sunday, marking an end to almost a century of neutrality

question_sentence: Which country imposed a strict national lockdown after confirming its first official Covid-19 infections?
evidence: State media said that a sub-variant of the highly transmissible Omicron strain had been detected in the capital city, Pyongyang

question_sentence: When Ncuti Gatwa takes up his role as the next Doctor Who, how many actors will have played the role before him?
evidence: The outgoing Jodie Whittaker was the 13th Doctor, and the first woman to play the iconic role. Gatwa will be the first black male to play the time lord

question_sentence: Boris Johnson announced plans to cut over 90,000 civil service roles following a cabinet away day in which city?
evidence: The prime minister told the Daily Mail that slashing Whitehall jobs would allow for tax cuts to alleviate the cost-of-living crisis

question_sentence: Which party became the largest at Stormont for the first time in Northern Ireland’s history following assembly elections?
evidence: Sinn Féin, which supports a united Ireland, edged out the Democratic Unionist Party to become the single largest party

question_sentence: The ‘Wagatha Christie’ trial was triggered after Coleen Rooney accused Rebekah Vardy of leaking stories to which tabloid?
evidence: Vardy launched a libel action after Rooney accused her of leaking stories from her private Instagram to The Sun

question_sentence: Which supermarket is piloting a scheme that will allow people to hire out office space from its stores?
evidence: A 3,800 sq ft area in Tesco’s New Malden supermarket will be offered up in a deal with flexible office operator IWG

question_sentence: A nationwide shortage has left parents scrambling to find which product in stores?
evidence: Manufacturers say they’re producing baby formula at full capacity, but it’s still not enough to meet the current demand.

question_sentence: A fleece jacket worn and signed by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky was recently auctioned off at a fundraiser for Ukraine. How much did it fetch?
evidence: The Ukrainian Embassy in London auctioned Zelensky’s jacket for around $111,000. The event raised more than $1 million. Other items sold included toys donated by Ukrainian First Lady Olena Zelenska and photos by a photographer killed in the conflict.

question_sentence: The nationwide search for a former Alabama corrections officer and the inmate she disappeared with came to an end this week. In which state was the pair finally caught?
evidence: Vicky White, 56, and Casey White, 38, were captured in Evansville, Indiana, following a car chase with authorities who tracked them down following a tip that came from the public. Vicky White died from an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound, officials said.

question_sentence: Who won the Philippines presidential election?
evidence: Ferdinand Marcos Jr., the son and namesake of the late dictator, won the Philippines presidential election by a landslide, preliminary and unofficial results show. With more than 95% of the votes counted, Marcos Jr. has about 30 million votes, more than double that of his closest rival.

question_sentence: Which famous piece of art was bought for a record $195 million this week?
evidence: Andy Warhol’s iconic Marilyn Monroe portrait “Shot Sage Blue Marilyn” was sold this week for $195 million, making it the most expensive 20th-century artwork ever to go under the hammer.

question_sentence: The House of Representatives passed a roughly $40 billion funding package this week. If it passes the Senate, what will the money be used for?
evidence: If approved, the $40 billion measure will help deliver aid to Ukraine as it continues to face Russia’s brutal assault.

question_sentence: The national average price for a gallon of regular gasoline continued to climb higher into record territory this week. Drivers in which state are feeling the most pain at the pump?
evidence: Drivers in California paid nearly $6 per gallon this week, the latest readings show.

question_sentence: Which country suffering an economic crisis plunged further into chaos this week after protesters burned down homes belonging to at least 38 politicians?
evidence: Angry Sri Lankans destroyed and damaged dozens of homes belonging to politicians this week. They are protesting against what they say is the government’s mishandling of the country’s worst economic crisis since 1948.

question_sentence: Which banned Twitter user did Elon Musk say he will allow back on the platform if his $44 billion deal to acquire the company is completed?
evidence: Elon Musk said that he would restore former President Donald Trump’s banned Twitter account if his deal to acquire the company is completed. The comments come after Musk previously said he thinks Twitter should be more “reluctant to delete things” and “very cautious with permanent bans.”

question_sentence: Which country’s leaders announced their support for joining NATO this week?
evidence: Finland’s president and prime minister announced their support for joining NATO, moving the Nordic nation — which shares an 800-mile border with Russia — one step closer to membership in the US-led military alliance.
